page.title: 12FARMING
page.content: Mr.Hoskings farm owns 65 acres and rents 21 acres in the summer.The farm is a dairy farm with 90-100 livestock at any one time.Mr.Hosking keeps Fresian cows.The produce 12 to 13 thousand gallons of milk every year. There milk contains 3\%-4% butter fat compared to gurnseys which gives 5%-6% .Butter fat is used to produce butter, cream etc...but Fresians give more milk.The cows produce more milk in the spring this is because of the new grass.To keep the fields in good condition it costs Mr.Hoskings Â£40 an acre per year,as he has 86 acres to look after this amounts to Â£3440 a year.He gets 15p a litre in summer and in the winter he gets 16p.There is a lot less manul work on the farm now then there was since the machinery was introduced.
